meanings.definition: Given to or characterized by deceit or deception
meanings.sent1: The trickish fox pretended to be injured to trick the other animals.
meanings.sent2: She had a trickish smile that made me suspicious of her intentions.
meanings.sent3: The trickish magician made the audience believe he could make things disappear.
meanings.sent4: His trickish ways eventually caught up with him, and he was exposed as a fraud.
meanings.sent5: The trickish salesman convinced people to buy things they didn't need.

meanings.sent1: The trickish raccoon outsmarted the campers and stole their food.
meanings.sent2: She gave him a trickish look before pulling a prank on him.
meanings.sent3: The trickish cat knocked over the vase and then acted innocent.
meanings.sent4: His trickish ways helped him win the game by outsmarting his opponents.
meanings.sent5: The trickish student always found a way to avoid getting caught for misbehaving.

meanings.definition: Involving or characterized by tricks or deception
meanings.sent1: The trickish puzzle was designed to confuse even the smartest players.
meanings.sent2: He had a trickish plan to get revenge on his rival at the talent show.
meanings.sent3: The trickish plot of the movie kept the audience guessing until the end.
meanings.sent4: Her trickish behavior at work made it hard for her colleagues to trust her.
meanings.sent5: The trickish maze was full of hidden passages and false exits.
